intro: Hieracium tromsdalense, commonly known as Tromsø hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Arctic and alpine regions. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish to greenish flowers arranged in a flat-topped cluster. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to cold climates. It has hairy stems and leaves that help reduce water loss in harsh environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species within its habitat.
